description: A dashboard to present MySQL metrics in graph formats

panels.description:
Immediate: Represents the number of lock requests that were immediately granted without the requesting thread having to wait. WE WANT THIS TO BE HIGH

Waited: Represents the number of lock requests where the requesting thread had to wait because the lock was already held by another transaction - WE WANT THIS TO BE LOW.
panels.title: MySQL Locks (Rate - 1m)

panels.description:
One common cause of connection error is the lack of available connections.

This metric therefore shows the percentage of available connections
panels.title: Available Connections Used (%)

panels.description: A graph to check the available number of open files in the database system.
panels.title: Database System Open Files (%)

panels.description: MySQL uses in-memory cache to optimize the disk read and write operations. A low hit rate in the cache will impact the performance of the database. This graph will give us the value of the open tables cache hit rate:
panels.title: Cache Hit Rate (per 1m)

panels.description: One of the main sources of errors in databases is connection errors. This metric mysql_global_status_connection_errors_total allows you to detect when the database is generating these errors
panels.title: DB Connection Errors (Rate)

panels.description: The mysql.threads metric in MySQL signifies the current number of threads connected to the MySQL server. These threads can include various types such as client connection threads, replication threads, I/O threads, and more. Understanding this metric is crucial for assessing database performance and resource utilization. Here's how it impacts database performance:
panels.title: MySQL Threads

panels.description: The number of hours the MySQL database has been running.
panels.title: Database Uptime (Hours)

panels.description:
A graph to show when the Database has been up (reachable).

When the DB is reachable/up, the y-axis should equal to 1
When the DB is not-reachable/down, the y-axis should equal to 0
panels.title: Database Uptime (Graph)

title: MySQL Metrics
